intro: Grindelia stricta var. platyphylla, commonly known as the broadleaf gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in coastal and inland habitats. It has a taproot system and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The species is also valued for its historical use by indigenous peoples for medicinal purposes.
